newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexican peso closes weaker on bolsa sell-off.
newsitem.headline: Mexican peso closes weaker on bolsa sell-off.

text.p: The Mexican peso closed weaker against the U.S. dollar on Friday as profit-taking on the Mexican stock market and higher yields on the U.S. long bond roughed up the local currency, pushing it toward support at 7.50 to the dollar, traders said.
The bellwether 48-hour or spot peso gave up 1.85 centavos to 7.4900/7.4955, while the 24-hour peso lost 2.35 centavos to 7.4860/7.4910.
Earlier Friday, the same-day peso closed 0.55 centavo weaker at 7.4640/7.4680.
"We could really see the profit-taking on the bolsa," one trader said. "This was on top of the higher returns for the U.S. long bond and the normal weekend demand for dollars."
Dealers said the peso could come under more pressure next week because of traditional month-end dollar demand.
